item.title: Guessing UUIDs would actually take very long
item.description: UUIDs are 128-bit numbers. That means they have $2^{128}$ possible values which is roughly $3 \cdot 10^{38}$ (or in scientific notation, 3e38). Does this range make it safe for cryptographic purposes? Most people on the internet say an emphatic “No!”, so I am just keeping this here as a ðŸš¨ disclaimer. But is it at least collision-safe?
